intro: Corniola ferox, commonly known as the fierce corniola, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often used in traditional herbal medicine. Its small, white flowers appear in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Corniola ferox is valued for its medicinal properties, particularly for its anti-inflammatory and digestive benefits.
